Job Description

Introduction

This position will be based at the Kroondal Operations.

Description
The purpose of this position is to diagnose and maintain machinery and equipment according to technical specification and sound engineering practise.

Duties and Responsibilities
  • Investigate, diagnose and perform trade related maintenance and repair of equipment and machinery according to the maintenance requirements, standards and specifications
  • Perform daily inspections in accordance with the Mine Health and Safety Act regulations, operational and company standards to report all defects and breakdowns on equipment and machinery to the Supervisor
  • Develop, modify, construct and install all types of trade related equipment required for the safe operation of all engineering equipment
  • Ensure that all installations and equipment are safe and in good working order after task completion
  • Continuously monitor equipment failure and efficiency to improve trade specific equipment and systems
  • Consult with production teams on maintenance activities that effects production
  • Supports the achievement of engineering availability and production performance levels
  • Ensure that maintenance related information is recorded and reported to the relevant planning office to support the maintenance of the planned/asset maintenance system
Qualification Requirements
  • Grade 12 or equivalent qualification
  • Valid section 13 Trade test / Section 26(D) certificate required
  • Valid driver’s license code B, EB or C1
  • Own transport to attend to call outs
Experience and Skills Requirement
  • Minimum of 2-3 years’ experience as a qualified artisan in a mineral processing plant
  • Valid MV MQA Certification
  • VSD and Soft Starter experience
  • DP and Pro-V Simocode experience
  • English Language Proficiency
  • Time management skills

Job Description

Introduction

This position will be based at various Ensersa Maintenance sites.

Description

The purpose of this position is to diagnose and maintain machinery and equipment according to technical specification and sound engineering practise.

Duties and Responsibilities
  • Conduct trade related fault-finding on rigging and lifting equipment
  • Perform inspections and maintain inspection registers on lifting and working at heights equipment according to legislative requirements and to monitor and ensure compliance
  • Co-ordinate the maintenance of lifting and working at heights equipment to ensure adherence to legal requirements
  • Co-ordinate the availability of lifting equipment and machines by liaising with external suppliers
  • Plan, co-ordinate and execute all rigging and lifting tasks
  • Co-ordinate and lead risk assessments and complete lifting plans before proceeding with lifting operations
  • Monitor the efficiency of maintained lifting equipment and machinery to ensure engineering maintenance standards
  • Comply with permit procedures before proceeding with lifting operations
  • Record and file all data related to lifting operations and lifting equipment
Qualification Requirements
  • Grade 12 or equivalent
  • Valid Section 13 / Section 26(D) Trade Test certificate required
  • Valid driver’s license code B, EB or C1
  • Own transport to attend to call outs
Experience and Skills Requirements
  • Minimum of 2-3 years’ experience as a qualified Rigger in a mineral processing plant
  • English language proficiency
  • Time management skills
  • Must be able to work in confined spaces
  • Must be able to work at heights
  • Must be familiar with risk assessment procedures
  • Mobile Crane License will be an added advantage

Introduction

This position will be based at the Gamsberg site close to Aggeneys in the Northern Cape.

Description

The purpose of this position is to assist with housekeeping and engineering maintenance activities under instruction from the artisan/supervisor.

Duties and Responsibilities
  • Lifts, holds, positions and supports parts and materials being worked on, manually or with appropriate tools as required
  • Assists with dismantling and re-assembling of components as per instruction
  • Loads and off -loads materials and parts onto and from transport vehicles, as required
  • Lifts, carries and moves materials to and from storage areas by hand or non-self-propelled equipment
  • Assist with installations and breakdowns where services are required under instruction from the artisan or engineering supervisor
  • Performs general housekeeping duties
  • Perform observing role when instructed by Artisan / Engineering Supervisor, e.g. fire watch check for burning conveyors or checking pipeline for leaks

Job Description

Introduction
This position will be based at Quality Laboratory Services (QLS), Tanzania.

Description
This position is to be responsible for the efficient running and proper supervision of the Shift to ensure the receiving, preparation, analyses and dispatching of samples according to Laboratory processes and Client standards..

Duties and Responsibilities
• Follow the correct chemical control measures at all times and ensure accurate reagent stock counting to assist in accurate metal accounting
• Perform routine preparation of samples (crushing, pulverizing, filtering, rolling, splitting and drying)
• Logging and receiving of samples on the Laboratory Information Management System (LIMS)
• Marking and labelling of sample tags and sample containers
• Storing of samples according to specifications and colour codes
• Disposing of redundant ore samples
• Effective determination of particle size distribution
• Effective determination of moisture content of different feed streams
• Perform friability analyses on geological samples when required
• Perform sieve sizing analyses on samples
• Perform moisture analyses on samples
• Ensure detailed traceable records of all test work done
• Conduct daily pre-use checklists before operating moving machinery and report sub-standard equipment immediately to ensure optimized functionality of all lab equipment at all times
• Perform administrative duties to ensure record accuracy and availability at all times
• Compile neat and accurate dispatch sheets, checklists and registers and ensure distribution according to organizational requirements
• Responsible for ensuring optimized functionality of all lab equipment at all times
• Compile various production reports and ensure distribution according to organizational requirements.
• Adhere to quality requirements, verifications, calibrations, certifications of equipment

Qualification Requirements
• Degree or Diploma in Analytical Chemistry would be advantageous.
• Computer Literate in MS Office
• Valid driver’s licence code B, EB or C1

Experience and Skills Requirements
• 3 years’ experience as a Sampler performing basic sample preparation in a laboratory is required
• Knowledge and good understanding of the basic concepts of sample preparation, e.g. contamination, representative sample and integrity of a sample
• Knowledge of Laboratory Equipment
• Knowledge and experience in the Fire Assay method for Gold Assays
• Knowledge and experience working on an Atomic Absorption instrument
• Knowledge of the chemical composition, structure, and properties of substances and of the chemical processes and transformations that they undergo. This includes uses of chemicals and their interactions, danger signs, production techniques, and disposal methods
• Supervisor experience
• Time management

Job Description

Introduction
This position will be based at the Mansourah Massarah Project in Saudi Arabia on an 8/4 rotation schedule.  
 
Description
The purpose of this position is to manage the Engineering Planning office to ensure minimum downtime using the Pragma On Key Computerized Maintenance Management System .  

Duties and Responsibilities

• The Maintenance Planner coordinates and monitors all engineering maintenance and planning activities relating to the Technical and Metallurgical processes within the Plant
• Complement planned work by gathering critical information (resources, spares and tools arranged) for effective and safe execution
• Continually evaluate and motivate critical spares to support equipment reliability during its life cycle
• Actively assist in managing the work backlog
• The job holder is responsible for establishing and maintaining an accurate and comprehensive asset register, the incumbent is also responsible for managing the plant critical spares in collaboration with Engineer and materials controller
• The job holder is also responsible for the administration of these activities to make a positive contribution to the attainment of the Operation strategic objectives
• Key to this position is the participation in team activities and acceptance of accountability for his/her personal role which will assure alignment with the engineering department’s quest for technical excellence
• The Maintenance planner is responsible for the planning of responsibilities with the Engineer. Organising and controlling is done with the relevant Foreman and Process personnel to ensure an efficient workflow
• He/she is also responsible to create a work environment in which all can perform to their full potential
• The incumbent executes a variety of activities and works to strict standards and procedures and is accountable for proper office management
• Coordinate with subordinates to provide coverage during sick leave or vacation
• In order for the Maintenance Planner to contribute towards the safe and efficient achievement of set production targets, he/she will responsible to:
• Compile and maintain computerized asset plan to ensure that it is up to date at all times
• Provide asset reports to the Plant Engineer on a periodical basis and as required
• Compile requisitions as and when necessary to ensure that special equipment is in stock for work required
• Conduct in-depth root cause analysis and report the findings thereof to the Plant Engineer when major failures occur
• Compile monthly reports from CMMS (Computerized Maintenance Management) system and submit to respective parties
• Compile ad hoc reports as and when required by management or the client
• Optimize scheduled tasks based on historical plant equipment failures


Experience and Skills Requirements
• Expert knowledge of and training in the maintenance module ORACLE or other similar maintenance module.
• Minimum 5 years’ experience in a Maintenance Planning role
• English Language Proficiency 
• Computer literate in MS Office – Excel, Word, Power point, MS Projects
• Relevant planned maintenance system training, ORACLE would be an advantage
• Sound knowledge of Mining Engineering Codes of practices, policies and procedures.
• A good knowledge of machinery and equipment used on the relevant operations
• Understanding of engineering best practices and new technologies relating to engineering principles & processes
• Proven technical and maintenance capability
• Sound knowledge of Condition Monitoring practices
• Good working knowledge of Reliability-Centered Maintenance principles will be very advantageous
• Minerals Process Plant experience would be an advantage
• Experience in project planning and scheduling to include shut down planning in projects

Qualification Level
• Grade 12 or Equivalent
• Relevant Trade Test Certificate with 5 years’ experience as an Artisan and 2 years’ experience as a Foreman; or
• National Diploma Engineering with at least 5 years process plant experience

Job Description

Introduction

This position will be based in Saudi Arabia at the Ad’ Duwayhi Site.

Description

The purpose of this position is to supervise a section in the production area to ensure production targets are achieved according to the production plan.

Duties & Responsibilities:
  • Attend shift handover to obtain previous shift information and schedule shift resources accordingly
  • Perform visual inspections of work area to identify problems and report to the Shift Supervisor
  • Monitor production according to shift targets
  • Supervise and maintain a high standard of housekeeping
  • Provide maintenance support to Engineering department
  • Ensure the adherence to the specified process parameters within the respective sections and implement corrective actions accordingly
  • Identify causes of spillage in the plant and generate suggestions to minimise the spillage
  • Continuously monitor equipment failure and efficiency
  • Report breakdowns to the Shift Supervisor
  • Investigate and attend to visible process related maintenance problems, e.g. replacement of screens, idlers etc. where engineering is not required

Qualification Requirements:
  • Grade 12
  • National Certificate Mineral Processing Level 2 or equivalent Minerals Processing Qualification will be advantageous
Experience & Skills Requirements:
  • Minimum 5 years’ experience as a Process Section Supervisor
  • English language proficiency
  • Time management skills
  • Supervisory skills
  • Computer Literate in MS Office
  • Valid driver’s license code B, EB or C1

Job Description

Introduction

This position will be based in Greece.

Description

The purpose of the position is to manage and coordinate the implementation of SHEQ related programs and systems according to Minopex, client and legislative requirements.

Duties and Responsibilities
  • Ensure compliance to all legislative requirements according to Minopex SHEQ Objectives
  • Ensure the implementation of programs and systems across the Minopex sites to create awareness and compliance according to SHEQ objectives
  • Ensure the implementation and maintenance of the Minopex SHEQ Management System to monitor adherence to SHEQ and legislative requirements
  • Ensure that corporate objectives and targets are managed, and desired results are achieved
  • Ensure site level objectives and targets are in line with corporate and client objectives and targets and manage it accordingly
  • Provide and manage programs to assist sites to comply with legal requirements, i.e., Mine Health and Safety Act, Occupational Health and Safety Act, COIDA Act, OHSACT Regulations etc.
  • Monitor and report on all SHEQ related activities and actions according to organizational and legislative requirements
  • Ensure the auditing of SHEQ systems and compliance according to organizational standards and legislative requirements
  • Address non-conformances according to audit reports by developing and implementing corrective actions across operations
  • Ensure medical surveillance and occupational health programs are implemented, maintained and effectively managed
  • Ensure all legal appointments are in place, valid and correct according to required legislation
  • Facilitate Department of Minerals and Resources (DMR) visits and audits and actively drive any requirements identified
  • Facilitate and coordinate site certification processes according to ISO standards, (i.e., ISO 9001, 14001 & OHSAS 18001) to ensure adherence to client specification and organizational standards
  • Continuously analyze SHEQ information to identify problems, deviations and implement corrective actions accordingly
  • Lead incident/accident investigations to determine, report and eliminate root causes according to legislative and ISO requirements
  • Ensure the implementation of SHEQ related training and development to create awareness and adherence to legislative requirements
  • Provide specialist advise to internal and external stakeholders on SHEQ related programs, systems and adherence

Qualification Requirements
  • Grade 12 or Equivalent
  • Certificates or Diploma in SHEQ Management
  • Valid driver’s licence code B, EB or C1

Experience and Skills Requirements
  • Minimum 10 years’ experience and knowledge of plant operations.
  • SHEQ Auditors certificate
  • Computer Literate in MS Office
  • Presentation and report writing skills
  • Legal Liability Training
  • ISO 9001 Quality Management Training
  • ISO 14001 Environmental Management Training
  • ISO 45001 Occupational Health and Safety Management Systems Training
  • Advanced hazard Identification and Risk Assessment
